content.text: Install This DocC Package Directly In Xcode

inlineContent.text: You can get an installable version of this DocC package on

abstract.text: Status 104/100+
In Vim Mode, add a new line and switch to edit mode.
Find occurrences of a search term in the whole project.
Open quickly files using a search fuzzy search string
See important metrics of your app while debugging.
Show and hide the mini map in the editor and in Interface Builder.
Show and select currently open file in the project navigator
Add a symbolic breakpoint that prints the view controller class to the log console as soon as it’s shown
Remove artifacts from previous builds.
Quickly change the name of a variable in the current scope.
Find most Xcode features by typing parts of its name.
Find types in your project that conform to a protocol.
Navigate quickly between contexts, files and document items
Add code snippets to Xcode to make reusing code easier.
Add the current search to the bookmarks.
Embed selected text in quotation marks and parentheses.
Check contrast values of foreground and background colors.
Find next and previous change in the current file.
Add a description to a bookmark.
Change the appearance preview in the Interface Builder
Figure out the definition of a type or a function.
Add images for testing to the photos library of the iOS simulator.
Show distance between elements in Interface Builder.
Switch to the next or previous window tab.
Edit simultaneously several locations in a file.
Use bookmarks as to-dos and mark them as done when you done with a task.
Get a nice icon for your projects directory.
Reorder actions in a breakpoint.
Move the selected code one line up or down.
Quickly re-indent the selected code
Find usages of asset items.
Run a test repeatedly to find bugs they only happen some times.
Open the current file in another editor
Find the ancestors of a type.
Move a breakpoint from the project to the user to use it in other projects
Select the scheme to use for building
Check the changes that will be committed to the source control repository.
Continue the debugger to a line of code without adding a breakpoint.
Adjust the font size using dynamic type in the simulator.

doc://onehundredxcodetips.OneHundredXcod.title: Vim Mode: Move A Page Up/Down

abstract.text: Scroll a page up or down.
Open the Swift Programming Language Book by Apple from Xcode.
Open the Human Interface Guidelines from Xcode.
Activate a narrow line around views while running in the simulator
Find usages of a symbol in your project.
Execute the last command again.
Select next or previous occurrences of a selected word.
Search for occurrences of the work the cursor is currently located at.
Find the callers of a method or function.
Automatically switch to the build log when building starts.
Format a statement to multiple lines.
Automatically open or switch to a specific window tab when you start searching.
Play a sound when the build fails.
Use the Navigators to navigate between the different contexts of your project.
Show and hide the debug area.
Find the call hierarchy of a method.
Open a menu showing all views under the cursor
Change the font size in the Xcode editor using a shortcut
Start and stop a run.
Fold and unfold parts of your code.
Add a bookmark for a specific line in one of your files.
Add horizontal and vertical guides to a scene in the Interface Builder.
Show list of all items in the current document.
Show/hide authors of the code in the editor.
Let Xcode fix all issues with Fix-its in the current file.
Select a symbol from SFSymbols from within Xcode.
While searching within a file, jump to the next or previous occurrence.
Quickly perform common actions on your code.
Find views that could be optimized for highest rendering speed.
Find the next/previous occurrence of a character in the current line.
Add or remove a breakpoint in the line of the cursor
Search in the help menu for features of Xcode.
Place a breakpoint in a column of a code line.
Toggle between the changes and the repositories in the source control navigator.
Quickly switch appearance in the simulator.
Jump to a bookmark using Open Quickly.
Lookup the selected text in the documentation.
Move backwards and forwards in the editor navigation history
Change environment settings while your app is running in the simulator.
Make user interface animations slower on simulator.
Hide warnings in the issue navigator to concentrate on the errors only.
Activate relative line numbers to assist in vim movements.
Add errors and warnings to your code to be reminded of issues at compile time.
Activate layout rectangles to better understand the scenes in a Storyboard or a Xib
Window tabs help you to keep track of files you are working on.
Save screen recording of the simulator as a GIF.
Move the editor focus between editors in Xcode.
